title: Ticket #7517: Use s3.region, not s3-region in s3:// URL rewriting
description:
According to the AWS documentation, URLs of the form https://<bucket>.s3-<region>.amazonaws.com/<key> are (now) "legacy" forms, and we should be using https://<bucket>.s3.<region>.amazonaws.com/<key> instead.

We hadn't noticed this because all of the regions we've tested, except us-east-1, support the "legacy" form, and we've been testing that with the even older "path-style" URLs.
remarks:
2020-Feb-21 15:20:25 by tlmiller:
Should we allow the s3-<region> form? It's not going to work in some unpredictable cases (e.g., for us-east-1). Do we think there's anyone, or enough users, with the older-style URLs in working submit files, to worry about?

2020-Feb-21 15:57:39 by tlmiller:
The answer from ToddT is: no, not really, and this is new feature in 8.9, so we weren't making promises about it anyway.
2020-Apr-10 07:46:37 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.
